chapters.text:
-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 1          |
-------------------------------


###You are walking home after a long day.
#There's no doubt, this hasn't been a nice day.
#You missed every possible bus and/or train.
#And it started raining,# too. #Of course, you do not have an umbrella with you.

#Looking up at the sky, it looks like all the clouds in the world just decided to gather right above your head,#
swallowing all of light and propagating dark vibes to the atmosphere and to the ground.

A $WLightning$C suddenly strikes, #not too far away!

##You shudder, stunned with its power.

##After few breathless seconds, #you breathe again 
and smell the ozone that was formed by the action of the electricity over the oxygen molecules.

##You realise you have to move fast if you don't want to end up way more soaked than you already are.



(Select with arrow keys and press enter).

choices.desc: You start running. Let's minimise the water intake.
The water does not bother you that much. You are already soaked. So why rush?

chapters.text:
Speeding through the water, you feel the drops of rain smashing onto your face and body with unexpected strenght.
#You run even faster, trying to ignore the suffocating feeling of the water splashing down your face.
#
The wind howls between the unstopping, ever increasing noise of water hammering the asphalt.
#You feel your heart bouncing in your chest and hear your now accelerated breathing.
#
You are almost home, when you hear it.
#
$G...$C
###
Was it real? 
##For a split second you thought someone called on your name. It must have been all that noise...
#
#$G..ris..$C
###
It was clearer this time!

Resigned to your fate, you try to keep your head down,
trying to avoid being temporarily blinded by the water in your eyes.
#
The wind howls between the unstopping, ever increasing noise of water hammering the asphalt.
#
You also try to avoid the huge pools of water that are now forming on the road,
praying that no vehicle will rush over them splattering you with some nice mud.
#
You reach the bottom of the little hill that is in front of your house.
#You raise your eyes, and right when you are about to turn towards your gate, you see something.
#
On the top of the hill, there is something...# someone...# you can't say for sure.
##

choices.desc: You think you saw it wrong. Why waste time climbing the hill with this weather?
You decide to go and check. Someone could need help.

chapters.text:
You turn around, looking for the source of the voice.
#
It's hard to see something in the midst of this unexpected thunderstorm.
#You squint your eyes, fighting against the trickles of water that run into your eyes
#
After few seconds, you think you're seeing something.# On the top of the hill in front of your house.
#It looks like there is something... #someone...# there.
##But then you realise it's quite unlikely you could have heard your name called from that distance,
with all that noise.##

choices.desc: You hate to stay more time under the rain... but... you never know?
You must have misheard. And if something's there, it's none of your business.

chapters.text:
You painstakingly reach the top of the hill, where a lonely big oak tree stands.
#It looks like nobody is here after all.
#
You are about to go back down, to the comfort of your home at last, when you hear it!
#
$GChris!$C
#
You heard it right, you can't be wrong. It feels like the wind is calling your name to the rain...
#You feel a tingling sensation in the back of your neck,# somehow you $Wfeel$C someone's behind you.
#
#Then...## it all happen in an instant...##

The figure at the corner of your eye...
###The realisation that standing beneath a tree during a storm is not the safest option...
###The blinding light and the deafening boom suddenly engulfing you.
###
###Then...## only darkness.##

You are about to enter past your gate, to the comfort of your home at last, when you hear it!
#
$GChris!$C
#
It feels like the wind is calling your name to the rain...
#It feels like the sound comes from behind your shoulders, but at the same time from afar.

#You feel a tingling sensation in the back of your neck,# somehow you $Wfeel$C someone's behind you.
#
#Then...## it all happen in an instant...##

The figure at the corner of your eye...
###The blinding light...
###The deafening boom suddenly engulfing you.
###
###Then...## only darkness.

-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 2          |
-------------------------------


$G"You are alive..."$C##

Whose is that voice?# Your own?# Have you actually heard it?#

You slowly open your eyes, as thoughts resume their flow in your mind, trying to re-establish contact with reality.
#
It takes several second to clear up your sight. You feel quite wrecked.
#Just breathing deeply is a pain. You painfully, slowly sit up, and look around.
#
You don't recognise what you see. You try hard to remember, and it finally gets back to you.
How can you still be alive after being hit by...# the lightning?
#By the way,# you are still soaked to the bone.

$c"Maybe I am dead,# afer all."$C you say aloud, reconsidering the plausibility of that scenario.
#
In the meanwhile, you look at the small reddish vale that lies downhill.
#There is smoke ascending from what it looks like several fires or arsons.
#
You carefully stand up, getting dizzy until your sense of balance stabilises.
#

$D[When you see the prompt "\>", type an action you want to perform. Press TAB if you need help.]$C

$CThe first thing you notice is the sky, streaked with a cloud that looks like a jetstream of a plane.
#It has a strange, alien color.
#
The sun is setting, shedding its last light painting with odd glares the celestial vault,
which is already welcoming the faint sparkle of several stars.
#
A little downhill, you then notice an earth road going down towards the vale.
#It points in the direction of the fires.
#Looking more intently, you discern there must be some kind of village there.
#
It looks like there's nowhere else to go, at the moment.

You find your way downhill, following the earth path.

As you descend, the path gets narrower, meandering between an increasing number of trees.
#
Time passes, and night falls. Light recedes and you find yourself relying on the faint light of the stars.

As darkness takes hold, $rominous reddish glares$C paint the corners of the scene.
#You understand it's the light coming from the fires. You are getting closer.
#
The trees thin out and you can see the village entry a little further in front of you.

You won't waste time. You rush downhill flying over the earth road.

As you descend, the path gets narrower, meandering between an increasing number of trees.
#
This does not slow you down, nor the fact that running through the vegetation leaves
many marks on your skin, especially your arms and face.# You don't even realise it at the moment.

Time passes, and night falls. Light recedes and you find yourself relying on the faint light of the stars.

As darkness takes hold, $rominous reddish glares$C paint the corners of the scene.
#You understand it's the light coming from the fires. You are getting closer.
#
The trees thin out and you can see the village entry a little further in front of you.

You can't explain the reason of it to yourself, but for some reason, you start chuckling.
#Maybe it's the absurdity of the situation, or maybe it's a nervous reaction.
#
Anyway, you keep on laughing, louder and louder, until your voice becomes hysterical,
distorted, overlapped with its own echo.
##
After a while, you fell quite, the sound disperses around, and you feel some kind of sense of awkardness.

Your mind is rushing.
#$c"What is this place?"
#"Am I dead?"
#"Am I in some hell?"
#"How do I get home?"
#"Is there anybody here?"
#
$CAfter few moments, you burst out crying.# You weren't expecting it, but you can't help it.
#
After few minutes of what you classify as a pathetic scene, you feel better for some reason.

This is clearly impossible.# You must be dreaming.# Or maybe it's just some kind of sick prank.
#
Whatever it is, it's unacceptable. You feel your rage rising, supercharged by your pain and fear.
It soon becomes too much to hold inside, so you let out a mighty shout.
#
You scream at the space around you.
#To whoever might be listening.
#To your own fate.
#
You feel liberated.

You stand on this hill, like the one that is in front of your house.
#But the similarities end there. There are no places like this around your place,
maybe not even in your whole nation.
#
You are still wondering what happened and how did you end up here.
You try to keep calm, thinking about what to do next.

A small town lies in front of you.
#Or, to better say, what is left of it.
#
There is one main earth road that divides two main groups of houses, and little else.
Many buildings are in flames or already burnt to the ground.
Few others are seemingly intact.
#
There are no vehicles.
#No living soul is to be found around.
#

You keep on walking, and after few seconds you spot the first one.
##
$WA man.$C# Lying on his back, eyes wide open, staring into nothingness.
#An arrow stuck deep in his chest.# $WClearly dead.$C# Few flies buzzing around his mouth already.
##
You retch.

$c"Where the heck am I...?# What is going on?# What am I supposed to do?"$C you ask yourself when you feel better.
#
You keep on walking and realise the road is scattered with corpses.# Some kind of battle must have taken place...
#
You keep on walking, slowly, appalled.# You lose track of time, while your mind tries to grasp the reality.
#You cannot find an explanation to any of the things you are experiencing.


##After a while, you find yourself leaning on an empty doorframe of a house, which was somehow spared by the fire.
#
You shake up, shuddering. This reminds you that you should find some kind of shelter for the night,
#get dry,# and possibly not burnt.

choices.desc: You had enough for today. Nothing you may find inside the house could be worse than what is outside.
You just can't walk through that door, into the darkness...

chapters.text:
Overcoming fear with need, you enter the silent,# dark,# house.# You don't expect to find anybody in there.
#It's a very humble abode, earthen floor, small windows, few ornaments.
#
A fireplace signals the kitchen. A table, some chairs.# You suddenly realise how hungry you are.
#The only other room is the bedroom, a simple bed, a closet.
#All furniture pieces are made of the same wood.
#It doesn't look like there is running water anywhere. You can't even find a toilet.
#

$D[Usually, an action (verb) has to match an object (for example: $ddrink $Dthe $dwater$D)]$C

Driven away by the thought of what you could find inside that dark place, you resume your grim exploration.
#
The fires are almost out. Hostile embers spy on you from the corner of your eye.
#Not a sound, you feel and hear your own blood pumping in your veins.
##
You reach what looks like the center of that lost little town.
#There is a stone landmark in the middle of the square.
You feel a rush of gratitude when you discover it's a fountain.
#
You drink in a hurry, only now realising how thirsty you were.
#The water has a funny taste, but you are too overwhelmed to notice or care.
#You collapse on the ground, the most possible distant from any building,# fire,# or corpse.
